header.title: The best fence installation company in Pittsburg
bullets: FREE online tool to create your own custom quote.
Friendly, honest customer service from our Ergeon team!
Beautiful fence built by our skilled local contractors.

Yelp.description: My fence was falling down in the nightly windstorms at my house. Everyone was wonderful and good at communicating about the project. I love my new fence and not having to worry about the safety of my dogs. Highly recommend for follow through and high quality work. Great use of technology to create and document the quote and very efficient installation schedule.
Yelp.name: Samantha E.
Yelp.title: Great use of technology to create and document the quote and very efficient installation schedule.

Google.description: I contacted Ergeon through their website and received an immediate response. They sent a satellite photo of my property with measurements and after I confirmed they had a quote in my email within a few days. We had multiple quotes from others and theirs was the best with quality materials and a custom built gate. I highly recommend Ergeon.
Google.name: Jim W.
Google.title: They sent a satellite photo of my property with measurements and after I confirmed they had a quote in my email within a few days.

regulations.title: Permits & Regulations
regulations.description: See the undefined Permits & Regulations for undefined

faq.front-yard: 3 feet solid, 4.5 feet (3 feet solid + 1.5 feet 60% open top), 6 feet on Key Lots (only when sharing a property line with a rear yard)
faq.side-yard: 3 feet solid / 4.5 feet (3 feet solid + 1.5 feet 60% open) on property line, 6 feet beyond 3 feet setback
faq.setback: 3 feet for 6 feet height fences  on street side yard
faq.corner-lot-rules: 3 feet (Solid) / 4.5 feet (if 1.5 on top is 60% Open) within 30 feet visibility triangle measured from street lines intersections

articles.description: If you’re looking to get a new fence in California, it’s important to know about the laws surrounding fences and home improvement projects. Our post will go over some important things to keep in mind.

When it’s time to get a new fence it’s important to always use a reputable, licensed, and insured contractor. Some people try to cut costs by using unlicensed contractors, but this can end up being a major issue if any problems happen during the installation or down the line. In this post, we’ll go over the main reasons why you should always use a licensed and insured fence contractor.

There’s a lot to consider when weighing the pros and cons of a wood fence versus a chain link fence. We’ve tried to make the process easier for you by diving deeper into some of the areas of consideration.
